page.title: 16NONINGTON VILLAGE FETE 1985.
page.content: On Saturday 22nd. June we had a brilliant fete at the cricket ground. There were these sort of swing boats with ropes that you could pull to go faster and faster. My friend ,Neil Blackford, came on the swingboats with me. Later on the Canterbury Eagles very kindly put on some music. There was a marquee at the top of the field and it had displays of work from our school, the playgroup and local craftspeople. There were tractor rides right up through Fredville Park and the cows thought it was feeding time because we were sitting on bales of straw. All around there were different stalls:cakes, plants, hot dogs, ice cream and all sorts of side shows. At the end of the fete there was a Tug-of-War which was won by the girls.
